sys_embedded_tour_step.content:
Let's create a name for our new update set. When creating a name, it's important to consider any naming conventions you may have. If you're not sure, ask around! If you don't have any specific naming conventions in-place, here are some pointers:

  • Consider adding a version number to your update set name, to make it easy to group and merge related sets later on
  • If you are doing work that relates to a specific task number, consider including it.
    Example: INC0012345-v.1
  • Consider adding your initials, the project prefix, or some other identifier to the beginning of the update set name.
    Example: TW-INC0012345-v.1
  • If you know you might group your update sets into batches (more on that later), consider adding "BASE" or "Master" to the update set name.
    Example: TW-INC0012345-BASE
    Note: If you do use a batch base, make sure to also create a child update set, and create your update sets in that, as it's best to avoid putting updates directly in your batch base.
  • Never rename or otherwise change a system-generated update set (usually called "Default")

Clear out the contents of the Name field, put in your new update set name, and press TAB or click outside the field to continue.

Note: You can change this name later if you like, but not after you've marked it as complete.
sys_embedded_tour_step.name: Step 3
